title: Large Bank Consumer Mortgage Balances: Original Loan-to-Value (LTV): 50th Percentile
notes: The 50th percentile original loan-to-value (LTV) ratio. The original LTV ratio is the original loan amount divided by the lesser of the selling price or the appraised value of the property securing the mortgage at origination. Only mortgage accounts with LTV values greater than 0 percent and less than 125 percent are included in the original LTV percentile calculations.For more detail see: methodology (https://www.philadelphiafed.org/-/media/frbp/assets/surveys-and-data/y14/y-14-data-methodology).
